availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Wilson (Hamilton County, Ohio, fugitive from justice.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, fugitive from justice. Convicted of burglary and larceny in the Hamilton County Court of Common Pleas in February 1865. Escaped from the Hamilton County Jail on February 2, 1865. Fugitive from justice from February 1865 to March 1865. Arrested for burglary in Mason County, Kentucky, in March 1865. Returned to Ohio in April 1865.

ab.bibl:
"Law Report," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), February 1, 1865, p. 2.
"Escaped from Jail," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), February 3, 1865, p. 3.
"Recapture of the Burglar Wilson," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), March 28, 1865, p. 3.
"Law Report," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), March 31, 1865, p. 3.
"Law Report," Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), April 5, 1865, p. 2.
